By far my favorite game of all time. Reasons are
1. Its is right in between not enough, and too much stuff in general. 
2. I'm not even a puzzle game fan, but the puzzles are perfect. They were hard, but I was never stumped.
3. It actually hold up well graphically for a 14 year old game
4. The writing for GladOS is GREAT. Nothing ever felt out of place or weird, it flowed, adn all the jokes are super good.
The best puzzle game with a great storyline!
you have probably already played this.

This is pretty much the ultimate video game of all time, the pinnacle of gaming. Or at least it was before the sequel came out. Portal shaped minds, games, people. Are these really different things, though?
One of the best games i've played, ever

[b]Worth every penny![/b]

Still visually appealing even in 2021, Portal provides plenty of playtime and replay value with the achievements on offer.

Have a homicidal A.I. pit you up against a variety of logic puzzles in a first person setup, dodging childishly innocent turrets and brushing off snarky remarks, all whilst under the promise of delightfully moist cake. 

Get through the game, realise something you could have done differently with your newfound 'portal-logic' and eagerly do it all over again.

A must if you have never heard of portal before nor the half-life series it was originally shipped with, as much as for those who played it originally and are revisiting the franchise.

[h1] Привет из 2021, в это можно и нужно играть. [/h1]
В общем, сидел и как обычно думал, во что же поиграть. 
Портал прикупил в паке с халвой и вторым порталом по скидке. 
Слышал много хороших отзывов и рейтинг куда не кинься у портола отменный. 
Я вот сидел и думал, что же там такого годного. Порталы и порталы. Никого этим не Удивить. Тем более в 2021. 
Но я прошел залпом, не поднимая свою жепку со стула. 
Ладно, ладно [strike] пизжу [/strike] вру. Разок сходил попить водички. А то горло подсохло и мозги проветрить. 
Здесь и графа нормальная, даже по нынешним меркам, управление адекватное, сюжет с интригой, геймплей обалденный, мозгами приходится потрясти(это вам не казуальщина) и порофлить есть над чем. 
Чего только стоит один этот роботизированный иронизировано-саркастический юмор, сопровождающего тебя войса. 
Игру стоит брать и даже за фул прайс. Но лучше купить пак по скидке, который вальвоский.

10 порталов из 10

Стоит ли покупать игру?
Стоит.

玩到后面还是稍微卡了会关，而且后面确实会有点小晕，因为前面18关都比较短，所以第19关的时候总是觉得怎么还有，怎么还没完，前面的关卡基本上是白给，从16关开始难度才有点上来，我在18和19关确实有被卡到一下，通关用了5.1小时，这游戏确实很有创意，很独特，但也没有觉得说非常好玩，主要是玩着玩着会有点小晕，我觉得长度这样就好，再长点我都觉得难受了，场景也单调，音乐除了ED基本上就没有，所以在这个空间待久了会感觉挺不舒服的，那些对话我也没怎么认真看，感觉故事并不吸引我，第二部也不知道还玩不玩，只能说这游戏还不错，但我不是那么喜欢。

Хорошая игра, мне понравилась но некоторые уровни можно пройти не по сценарию (например там где присутствует много хадовочка можно пройти буквально за пару секунд вто время как по сценарию проход уровень идёт не меньше 10 минут)

Fun game, mind racking puzzles, interesting mechanics, and good story. Only complaints is that it is a bit short, and a pain in the butt to 100%

TLDR:  Decent puzzle-solving platformer.

Portal is a simple game but like a lot of games that start off simple, there's a surprising amount of depth in it.

The player wakes up in a sterile test chamber while a disembodied voice greets them and tells the player that they will be participating in tests conducted by Aperture Technology and their portal inventions (background info places this in the same universe as the Half Life games). The character isn't named aloud anywhere in the game but through a miracle of portals, you may catch a glimpse of the character, who is a woman of indeterminate race.

Portal is built on the Half-Life 2 engine and runs well on modern machines, though I had a couple of odd freezes that resolved after a few seconds. The game will have a familiar feel to any who's played HL2. Controls are standard, though the player can't sprint and the jumping is minimal. There are no weapons specifically. There is only the portal gun.

The portal gun allows the player to set up a portal on any smooth surface (specifically colored in-game) that the player can pass through. At first, the player will only be able to place blue portals, where the other end is fixed but after a few test chambers, the player will gain the ability to place orange portals, meaning the player can set their entry and exit, which opens a whole host of possibilities, all of which the player will need. They can put one portal on one side of a trench, the other on the other side, and cross. They can place a portal high on a wall, one on a floor below them, drop through and the let the falling momentum shoot through the exit portal and go flying through the air.

Each test chamber will get progressively more difficult. There are buttons that have to be pushed to open doors, energy balls to be directed into receptacles that power doors and platforms, etc. The chambers start off clean and shiny and simple but as the tests get harder, signs of decay start to appear. There are also some ominous hints along the way that not all is at it seems and things will eventually take an interesting turn. I can't say much else without spoilers.

Solving the puzzles is the best part of the game. Many have multiple solutions, though there is usually one "simplest" solution. I found too many of them involved momentum jumps, where the player has to jump and fall through one or more portals to build enough speed to fling across empty spaces. Other than falling in hazards (water, fire) the player won't die from falling. Most of the puzzles simply require thinking, though some--mostly those with that falling mechanism--also require some fast-reflexes for split-second portal placement. None of them are impossible but may take a few tries.

The story is interesting and the disembodied voice "guiding" the player is suitably creepy, so the game's ambiance is fine. The game is also relatively short; there are videos of people out there beating it under thirty minutes. Other than perfectionists who really enjoy the mechanics and want to perfect their runs, there's not a ton of replay value.

Steam Achievements are okay. Almost half involve the challenge maps--certain test chambers that are reset with extra-difficult additions. I did some of them but I wasn't enjoying myself enough to slog through all the challenges.

All in all, Portal is an interesting puzzle-game, with some platforming aspects. It comes on sale sometimes for a few bucks and it's certainly worth that.

Pros
- Lots of interesting puzzles to solve
- A simple story with a handful of twists

Cons
- Too many puzzles involving momentum
- Relatively short

Final Score: 6.5/10
